```{r}
maindata <- read.csv("/Users/saraswatishenoy/Documents/WashU courses/Adv Data Anakysis/pancreatic cancer.csv", header = T) 
# change column names
names(maindata)[2:13] <- c("Agegroup", "Sex", "YOD", "Race", "Cancersite", "Stage.AJCC", "Survival.months", "Status", "Event", "Insurance", "Age.years", "Age.diagnosis")
# change class
maindata$Insurance <- as.factor(maindata$Insurance)
maindata$Sex <- as.factor(maindata$Sex)
maindata$Race <- as.factor(maindata$Race)
maindata$Stage.AJCC <- as.factor(maindata$Stage.AJCC)
maindata$Survival.months <- as.numeric(maindata$Survival.months)
maindata$Event <- as.factor(maindata$Event)
maindata$Agegroup <- as.factor(maindata$Agegroup)
maindata$Age.years <- as.numeric(maindata$Age.years)
maindata$Status <- as.factor(maindata$Status)
maindata$Age.diagnosis <- as.numeric(maindata$Age.diagnosis)
# drop columns
maindata <- maindata[ ,c(1:10,11,13)]
# remove data
maindata <- maindata[maindata$Stage.AJCC != "Blank(s)", ]
maindata <- maindata[maindata$Stage.AJCC != "UNK Stage", ]
maindata <- maindata[maindata$Insurance != "Insurance status unknown", ]
maindata <- maindata[maindata$Race != "Non-Hispanic Unknown Race", ]
maindata <- maindata %>% drop_na()   #remove missing values
# Recode
maindata.1 <- maindata %>% 
  mutate(stage.cat = case_when(Stage.AJCC %in% c("IA", "IB") ~ "Stage I",
                               Stage.AJCC %in% c("IIA", "IIB", "IINOS") ~ "Stage II",
                               Stage.AJCC %in% c("III") ~ "Stage III",
                               Stage.AJCC %in% c("IV") ~ "Stage IV"),
         stage.cat = factor(stage.cat, levels = c("Stage I", "Stage II", "Stage III", "Stage IV")),
         stage.cat = relevel(stage.cat, ref = "Stage I"),
         insurance.cat = case_when(Insurance %in% c("Insured","Insured/No specifics") ~ "Insured",
                                   Insurance %in% c("Any Medicaid") ~ "Medicaid",
                                   Insurance %in% c("Uninsured")~ "Uninsured"),
         insurance.cat = factor(insurance.cat, levels = c("Insured", "Medicaid", "Uninsured")),
         insurance.cat = relevel(insurance.cat, ref = "Insured"),
         event.cat = case_when(Event %in% c("Dead (attributable to this cancer dx)") ~ 1,
                               Event %in% c("Alive or dead of other cause","Dead (missing/unknown COD)", 
                                             "N/A not first tumor") ~ 0),
         event.cat = factor(event.cat, levels = c(0,1), labels = c("Censored", "Dead")),
         Race  = relevel(Race, ref = "Non-Hispanic White"),
         age.cat = case_when(Agegroup %in% c("20-24 years","25-29 years","30-34 years","35-39 years") ~ "< 40",
                             Agegroup %in% c("40-44 years","45-49 years") ~ "40-49",
                             Agegroup %in% c("50-54 years","55-59 years") ~ "50-59",
                             Agegroup %in% c("60-64 years") ~ "60-64"),
         age.cat = factor(age.cat, levels = c("< 40", "40-49","50-59","60-64")))

# table 1
table1(~age.cat + Sex + Race + stage.cat  + Survival.months + Status + Age.diagnosis | insurance.cat, maindata.1)

# changing label
label(maindata.1$age.cat) <- "Age group"
label(maindata.1$stage.cat) <- "Stage at diagnosis"
label(maindata.1$Survival.months) <- "Survival time in months"
label(maindata.1$Age.diagnosis) <- "Age at dignosis (years)"

table1(~age.cat + Sex + Race + stage.cat  + Survival.months + Status + Age.diagnosis | insurance.cat, overall = "Total", rowlabelhead = "Variable", footnote = 'SD = Standard Deviation', maindata.1)

#Figure 1
grViz("digraph flowchart {
      node [fontname = NewCenturySchoolbook, shape = rectangle, fontsize=10] #node definitions with substituted label text
      tab1 [label = '@@1']                                              #notes indicate how many boxes you will have in        tab2 [label = '@@2']                  #your diagram. Since I have two sets of exclusions, I will have three nodes.
      tab3 [label = '@@3']  
      tab1 -> tab2 -> tab3 
      }
      [1]: 'Records received from SEER for pancreatic cancer diagnoses n=34,314'
      [2]: 'Excluding 6,705 individuals with blanks or unknown stage, insurance and race n=27,605'
      [3]: 'Excluding 1,348 individuals with missing data on variables used in the analysis n=26,257'
      ")

# Interpretation

# Age : At diagnosis, those uninsured/had medicaid were on average younger than those insured with mean ages of 54.9 (SD = 7.26), 54.6 (SD = 7.33) and 56.1 (SD = 6.83) respectively.

# Race : Majority of the patients belonged to Non-Hispanic White race irrespective of their insurace category. However, Non-Hispanic Black were higher in the medicaid/uninsured group compared to Insured.

# Stage at diag : A higher percentage of patients from Medicaid (61.8 %)/uninsured (63.7 %) group were diadnosed at stage IV than the Insured group (55.6 %).

# Survival months: The median survival months is highest for the insured group (9 months) followed by Medicaid (5 months) and Unisured (4 months) group.

# Vital status : A higher percentage of patients from Medicaid (89.7 %)/Uninsured (86.4 %) group died during study period than Insured (85.1%) group.
```

# MLR
```{r}
maindata.mlr <- multinom(stage.cat ~ insurance.cat + Age.diagnosis + Sex + Race, data = maindata.1)
summary(maindata.mlr)

## extract the coefficients 
exp(coef(maindata.mlr))

#get confidence intervals for ORs
exp(confint(maindata.mlr, level=0.95))

#for interaction
maindata.mlrrace <- multinom(stage.cat ~ insurance.cat + Age.diagnosis + Sex + Race + Race*insurance.cat, data = maindata.1)
summary(maindata.mlrrace)

lrtest(maindata.mlr, maindata.mlrrace)

# Interpretation
#Being uninsured does not contribute significantly to diagnosis of Stage II (OR = 0.9; CI 077-1.23, p>0.05) and stage III (OR = 1.25 CI 0.96-1.61, p>0.05) compared to Stage I than insured cases, after adjusting for other variables.

#The odds of being diagnosed at Stage IV pancreatic cancer vs Stage I is 1.45 (CI 1.17-2.80, p<0.05) times higher for Unisured cases than Insured, after adjusted for other variables.

#Having any medicaid does not contribute significantly to diagnosis of Stage II (OR = 0.9; CI 077-1.23, p>0.05) and stage III (OR = 1.25 CI 0.96-1.61, p>0.05) compared to Stage I than insured cases.

#The odds of being diagnosed at Stage IV pancreatic cancer vs Stage I is 1.45 (CI 1.17-2.80, p<0.05) times higher for Unisured cases than Insured, after adjusted for other variables.

# By lrtest, p-value for interaction model is not significant (p>0.05). Race does not modify association between stage of pancreatic cancer diagnosis and insurance status. 
```

# To check if race modifies the association of survival of pancretic cancer and insurance status

```{r}
# Recode
maindata.2 <- maindata %>% 
  mutate(stage.cat = case_when(Stage.AJCC %in% c("IA", "IB") ~ "0",
                               Stage.AJCC %in% c("IIA", "IIB", "IINOS") ~ "1",
                               Stage.AJCC %in% c("III") ~ "2",
                               Stage.AJCC %in% c("IV") ~ "3"),
         stage.cat = factor(stage.cat, levels = c(0,1,2,3), labels = c("Stage I", "Stage II", "Stage III", "Stage IV")),
         stage.cat = relevel(stage.cat, ref = "Stage I"),
         insurance.cat = case_when(Insurance %in% c("Insured","Insured/No specifics") ~ "0",
                                   Insurance %in% c("Any Medicaid") ~ "1",
                                   Insurance %in% c("Uninsured")~ "2"),
         insurance.cat = factor(insurance.cat, levels = c(0,1,2), labels = c("Insured", "Medicaid", "Uninsured")),
         insurance.cat = relevel(insurance.cat, ref = "Insured"),
         event.cat = case_when(Event %in% c("Dead (attributable to this cancer dx)") ~ 1,
                               Event %in% c("Alive or dead of other cause","Dead (missing/unknown COD)", 
                                             "N/A not first tumor") ~ 0),
         #event.cat = factor(event.cat, levels = c(0,1)),
         Race  = relevel(Race, ref = "Non-Hispanic White"),
         age.cat = case_when(Agegroup %in% c("20-24 years","25-29 years","30-34 years","35-39 years") ~ "< 40",
                             Agegroup %in% c("40-44 years","45-49 years") ~ "40-49",
                             Agegroup %in% c("50-54 years","55-59 years") ~ "50-59",
                             Agegroup %in% c("60-64 years") ~ "60-64"),
         age.cat = factor(age.cat, levels = c("< 40", "40-49","50-59","60-64")))
```


```{r}
panc.surv <- survfit(Surv(Survival.months, event.cat) ~ insurance.cat, data = maindata.2)
panc.surv

ggsurvplot(panc.surv, data = maindata.2, risk.table = TRUE, conf.int=TRUE, tables.theme = clean_theme())

panc.cph <- coxph(Surv(Survival.months,event.cat) ~ insurance.cat, data = maindata.2)
summary(panc.cph)

#adjust cov
pancadj.cph <- coxph(Surv(Survival.months,event.cat) ~ insurance.cat + Age.diagnosis + Sex + Race, data = maindata.2)
summary(pancadj.cph)

#for interaction
pancadj1.cph <- coxph(Surv(Survival.months,event.cat) ~ insurance.cat + Age.diagnosis + Sex + Race + Race*insurance.cat, data = maindata.2)
summary(pancadj1.cph)

lrtest(pancadj.cph, pancadj1.cph)
```
#Interpretation

The median survival for Insured patients is 10 months while for unisured/medicaid patients is 5 motnhs.

#Interpretation

Those patients from medicaid/unisured group had 1.4/1.42 times higher hazard of death than those from insured group. 
The model is overall significant. (p<0.05 for wald test, likelihood ratio test,logrank test)

# Interpretation

After adjutsing for covariates, those patients from medicaid/unisured group had 1.46/1.45 times higher hazard of death than those from insured group. 
The model is overall significant. (p<0.05 for wald test, likelihood ratio test,logrank test)

# Check cox assumptions

```{r}
## 1. Log-log curves: log(-log(survival)) against log(time)
pancsurv <- Surv(maindata.2$Survival.months, maindata.2$event.cat)
pancsurv

plot(survfit(pancsurv ~ maindata.2$insurance.cat), col=c("black", "red"), main= "insurance log log plot", fun="cloglog", xlab="Time", ylab="log(-log(S(t)))") #ph assumption violated(not parallel)

## 2. Schoenfeld goodness-of-fit test 
#You want this test to be non-significant.
#There should be no pattern in the smoothed black line with time if the ph assumption is met.
panc.gof<-cox.zph(pancadj.cph, terms=FALSE)
panc.gof
#plot
ggcoxzph(test.ph)


# For violation: Stratified Cox PH regression by covariate not meeting the PH assumption
# model adjusted for sex and WBC that accounts for violation of ph assumption by sex
cox.sexadj <- coxph(Surv(Survival.months,event.cat) ~ insurance.cat + Age.diagnosis + + Race + strata(Sex) , data=maindata.2)
summary(cox.sexadj)
```
